citation.article-title: Hydrogenoanaerobacterium saccharovorans gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from H2-producing UASB granules.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Hydrogenoanaerobacterium (Hy.dro.gen.o.an.ae.ro.bac.te′ri.um. N.Gr. n. hydrogenon hydrogen; Gr. pref. an- without; Gr. n. aer air; Gr. neut. n. baktron a small rod; N.L. neut. n. Hydrogenoanaerobacterium an anaerobic, hydrogenogenic, rod-shaped bacterium).
Gram-stain-negative, but with an atypical Gram-positive structure cell wall.
Cellular fatty acids consist mainly of saturated fatty acids and iso-branched fatty acids, predominantly C14 : 0, iso-C15 : 0, C16 : 0 and iso-C17 : 1ω9c.
Various mono-, di- and oligosaccharides, including glucose, are fermented.
The major end products from glucose are ethanol, acetate, hydrogen and carbon dioxide.
The type species is Hydrogenoanaerobacterium saccharovorans.
